entry.title: Forking personal "vanity" versions...
entry.summary: In a forum post made by Alan Grimes, he defends the existence of multiple versions of bitcoin which some people have criticized as being too many. In response, another user has expressed their frustration with these types of posts and called them useless and a reason why people don't use the forums anymore. The post is seen as not contributing anything meaningful to the discussion and lacking in substance. This exchange highlights the ongoing debate within the cryptocurrency community about how many different versions of bitcoin should exist and whether or not they are necessary. It also brings up issues of forum etiquette and what kind of posts are considered valuable contributions.
